title: Clegg demands apology from Theresa May over 'false and outrageous' claim: Politics live blog | Politics | The Guardian
summary: clegg demanding apology from may for 'false and outrageous claim ' about lib dems .

documents.title: lunchtime summary
text: a bitter row has broken out between nick clegg , the deputy prime minister , and theresa may , the home secretary , over the lib dems ' stance on the so-called snooper 's charter proposal .
clegg used his lbc phone-in to accuse her of making false and outrageous '' slurs when she claimed in her party conference speech that lib dem opposition to the measure was putting lives at risk .
clegg demanded an apology .
but may is refusing to back down .
a source close to her said : maybe clegg is becoming as forgetful as ed miliband but we have n't received a letter from him .
it 's interesting to see how the lib dems react to the logic of their position being aired in public but the truth is that they are putting lives at risk right now .
if they want to do something about that , they can start talking to us about returning to the comms data bill that nick clegg first torpedoed on his radio show two years ago .
in a separate briefing , a source close to may was even more blunt .

james chapman ( mail ) ( @ jameschappers ) home office source responding to lib dem attack on theresa may : 'nick clegg is a w ' lord hill , britain 's choice to be eu commissioner , may be charming but he has little to no grasp of his financial services brief , one of the politicians scrutinising his appointment has said .
nicola sturgeon has urged david cameron to block the introduction of universal credit in scotland until final decisions are made on devolving new welfare powers to holyrood .
douglas carswell , the tory mp who defected to ukip and who is now standing in the clacton byelection , has said david cameron 's conference speech shows the tories are adopting ukip policies .
what do you know ?
people start going for a new alternative that believes in many of the things that that once-great party believes in and suddenly the prime minister starts talking a ukip-y kind of language .
i wonder why that might be .
but it was too late , carswell said .
jonathan powell , tony blair 's former chief of staff , has said britain and its allies should be talking to islamic state .

speaking on the today programme , he said that while politically unpalatable , his experience of dealing with the ira towards the good friday agreement and recent history suggested it was vital to negotiate with the jihadists .
i want people to learn some of the lessons from history .
we keep making the same mistakes again and again .
every time we meet a new terrorist group we say we will never talk to them and yet we do in the end .
that kind of channel is what you need to have with all terrorist groups and when you can , you turn that into negotiation .
a government troubleshooter and former businessman has been appointed as the first chief executive of the civil service .
as the press association reports , john manzoni , currently head of the major projects authority ( mpa ) , will take on the £ 190,000-a-year post next month .
that 's all from me for today , i 'm afraid .
i 'm wrapping up early , but it does n't look as if i 'll miss much this afternoon .
i 'll be back on sunday morning , when i 'll be covering the lib dem conference in glasgow .
thanks for the comments .
matthew hancock , the skills minister , has apologised for retweeting a tweet saying labour is full of queers '' .
it was a total accident , and he disagrees with the offensive '' comment , he says .
matt hancock ( @ matthancockmp ) previous rt was a total accident .
i wholeheartedly disagree with offensive comment in the tweet & am incredibly sorry for any offence caused
tim farron , the lib dem president , has given an interview to the total politics magazine .
here are the key quotes .
farron said the lib dems would have to campaign positively at the next election , and not just stress the tory ideas they 've blocked in coalition .
stopping bad things is worth doing but there are n't a lot of votes in that .

you inspire people , normally speaking , by giving them hope , genuine hope , and deciding that we can have a government that is liberal , pro-civil liberties , and is active , proactive , and a can-do government .
give people a reason to vote for the lib dems .
he said the labour leadership had been super-disappointing '' .
i think labour 's leadership has been super-disappointing .
the general approach for this last four and a bit years has been , 'sit tight , say as little as possible , throw a few bricks and then go and hope the tide turns our way ' .
which is still the plan , and it might work , but the labour party has shown itself incapable of being a serious , constructive opposition , and it 's a desperate shame .

it 's shown itself to be quite illiberal on some of the rhetoric over anti-terror legislation , over the racist , 'go home ' vans , labour was at best mute , at worst being cheerleaders for the tories .
he said david cameron was weak because he had not stood up to rightwingers in his party .
strong leaders stand up to difficult people in their parties , certainly on an ideological front .
he 's encouraged the right , the dismantle-ist tendency , and i think that 's a shame .

when you hear very right-wing , very anti-populist , very anti-british , very uncivilised things coming from the conservatives that cameron gives a little bit too much encouragement to , or not enough time to stand up to , it 's a reminder of how important it is that we are in coalition .
here 's the guardian video of nick clegg accusing theresa may of making false and outrageous '' claims about the lib dems in her conference speech .
matthew hancock , the skills minister , has deleted a tweet saying labour is full of queers '' , political scrapbook reports .
earlier , after nick clegg made the point that policy initiatives that look good on the day often backfire , i asked for other examples .
on twitter several people have an obvious one .
whydidhessfly ( @ whydidhessfly ) @ andrewsparrow clegg and tuition fees here 's another one too .
ian ( @ ianwatoop ) @ andrewsparrow `` back to basics ''
yesterday demos published some research showing that david cameron 's conference speech received 10 times as much negative comment on twitter as positive comment .
twitter was kinder to ed miliband , who only received four times as much negative comment as positive comment after this speech .
today a social media analytics firm called talkwalker has published a slightly different analysis .

it also found that references to david cameron and to the conservative party on social media were predominantly negative , although not to the extent demos found for twitter , but it also found that positive references went up after the speech .
here are the figures from their news release .

conservative party before david cameron 's speech 48 % negative 11 % positive after the speech 46 % negative 17 % positive david cameron before the speech 49 % negative 13 % positive after the speech 34 % negative 27 % positive talkwalker looked at more than 75,000 social media references to cameron and his party .
these figures are out of kilter with the press reaction to the speech .
( see 8.52am . )
does that mean that the press has got it wrong ?
not necessarily ( although anyone who tried to use the press as a reliable guide to public opinion would be barmy . )
one obvious point is that tory support is highest amongst old people , and social media use is highest amongst the young .
in scotland , before the independence referendum , support for yes on social media outnumbered support for no by 2:1 , or more , but that did not help at all as a forecast for the final result .
for the record , here are today 's yougov gb polling figures .

labour : 38 % ( up 2 points from yougov yesterday ) conservatives : 31 % ( no change ) ukip : 15 % ( no change ) lib dems : 7 % ( no change ) labour lead : 7 points ( up 2 ) government approval : -22 ( up 1 ) according to electoral calculus , this would give labour a majority of 88 .
theresa may , the home secretary , plans to write back to nick clegg in strong terms '' defending what she said at the conservative party conference , according to sky news .

documents.title: nick clegg 's phone-in - summary
text: here is a full summary of the main points from nick clegg 's phone-in clegg accused theresa may , the home secretary , making an outrageous '' and appalling '' false claim about the lib dems in her party conference speech and said that coalition relations had hit a new low point '' as a result .
he said that he had sent her a very strong letter demanding an apology .
in her speech may claimed that lib dem opposition to the so-called snooper 's charter was putting lives at risk .
the lib dems rejected this claim on the day , but clegg went much further today .
asked about may 's speech , he said : i thought it was one of the most misleading and outrageous platform speeches i 've heard in conference seasons for a very long time absolutely appalling .
this is a new low point in coalition relations .
may talked about the national crime agency having to drop cases they were going to take to court .
but , clegg said , the facts were quite difference .
the nca dropped the cases because it could not link ip addresses to mobile devices .
he said he had been urging the home office to address this for months .
and guess who has been dragging their feet to deal with it ?
the home office .
i think i 'm entitled to be a little bit aggrieved to hear a conservative home secretary somehow claim that my party is putting children at risk when it is their inactivity which is doing just that .
he said that he had written may letter demanding an apology .
asked it it was very strong '' , he said it was .

i have made it very , very clear to her that i expect an apology from her for making such a false and outrageous claim to say about another politician , particularly someone you are governing with , that you are putting children at risk , when it 's not true , is a level of outrageous misinformation that i have not witnessed in the four and a half years i 've been in this government .
he said that under the tories the working poor would get poorer and public services would be absolutely decimated '' .
i think [ david cameron 's ] was a cynical speech because one thing we know form the conservative party conference now is two things .

we know now two things for absolutely sure , which is that if the conservatives were ever to become a majority government , and god help us if there 's either a labour or tory-only government in this country after 2015 .
if there were , two things would happen .
the working poor would become poorer .

with almost undisguised relish george osborne announced in his speech that they would not ask very wealthy people to pay a single extra penny in tax any unfunded giveaway , which we heard from david cameron , has to be paid for and the conservative answer is the only people who pay , the only section of the population they would is the working age poor .

and the second thing we now know is that public services , like social care , the police , other things that people really rely on , will be absolutely decimated and cut to the bone because they refuse to ask anyone on much , much higher incomes to make any contribution as he completes the job of filling the black hole in the public finances .
he suggested that it was hypocritical for david cameron to back raising the basic income tax threshold to £ 12,500 when in the past he has resisted this idea in coalition .
it is not what they have been saying for the last four and a half years .

every time danny alexander and i said , 'look , we 've got to raise the tax allowance ' , david cameron and george osborn both would say , 'nick , this is your tax break , why do you want this tax break , you 're going to have to give some other concessions ' .
if imitation is the sincerest form of flattery , then we 're making progress .
he said the unfunded tax cuts proposed by the conservatives would backfire on them in due course .
i really think it is going to unravel big time over the next seven months .
i have seen this before in politics .
things that are praised to the rafters are often precisely the commitments that then unravel the most later .
( a good example would be gordon brown 's decision to abolish the 10p starting rate of tax .
can you think of any others ? )
he said labour had no new ideas and the conservatives had no new ideas of their own .

i 've been watching the labour and conservative party conferences , or as much as i can bear , and the that is emerging , you 've got one party , the labour party , with no new ideas and another party with no new ideas of their own .
he said the lib dems would have quite a lot '' to say about tax at their conference .
nick clegg
q : when are you going to start spouting lib dem policies ?
clegg says he is not just spouting them .
he is delivering them .
he lists a series of messages , including the increase in the tax threshold and the pupil premium .
q : do you have a pair of paisley pyjamas ?
clegg laughs .
no , he says .
nick ferrari asks if he wears pyjamas .
he apologises for the question .
clegg says he has a trendy pair .
q : do you think the sunday mirror story was entrapment ?
clegg says it was right that brooks newmark resigned .
q : was it a fishing trip ?
it is right that ipso , the new regulator , is looking at this .
he does not think it is a good idea for politicians to give a running commentary on what the media should and should not do .
q : what do you say about the free movement of eu citizens in the light of the alice gross case , and the latvian suspect ?
clegg says , if a briton serves his time , you would not stop him travelling elsewhere in the eu .
but data should be made available to all eu states .
he would not approve of banning ex-prisoners from travelling , he says .
q : my son was told he could not eat sausages at school .
when my wife asked why , she was told pork was not served , because some members of the community objected ?
clegg asks where the school is ?
q : that should not make a difference .
why is my son denied pork ?
clegg says the school should be able to ensure some pupils can have pork , and some can have an alternative .
q : what do you feel about the fact that eu residents with non-eu spouses can come to the uk easily , but uk citizens with a non-eu spouse has to apply for a spouse visa .
clegg says he will look into this and get back to the caller .
clegg says he has been following the other party conferences .
one party , labour , had no new ideas .
and another , the conservatives , had no new ideas of their own .
he says that he and danny alexander have been pushing the tories for years to raise the basic tax allowance .
the tories have made it clear that public services will suffer badly under their spending plans , he says .
and he says it is also clear that they will take money from the working poor .
clegg says the lib dems will be saying a lot about tax at their own party conference next week .

documents.title: clegg demanding apology from may for 'false and outrageous claim ' about lib dems
text: q : why do we have to go to iraq to tackle extremism ?
it is a problem in london too .
clegg says britain is intervening in iraq because the government there asked for help .
q : what about the argument this puts more britons at risk ?
clegg says islamic state ( isis ) were chopping off the heads of innocent brits '' even before the commons voted for military strikes .
q : is turkey signing up for military action ?
clegg says he thinks the vote in turkey today is about it accepting ground troops from other countries on its soil .
turkey is actually crucial to the fight against isis , he says .
it is our great ally in the region , he says .
and it 's a member of nato .
q : so did you cheer to the echo theresa may 's speech ?
no , says clegg .
her speech was misleading and outrageous '' .
it was absolutely appalling - a new low point in coalition relations . ''
may said the lib dem opposition to the so-called snooper 's charter was putting lives at risk .
but , clegg says , the national crime agency dropped the cases mentioned by may because ip addresses were not matched to names .
clegg says he has been going on about this problem for months , but the home office has not acted .
he said he was demanding an apology from may .
i have made it very , very clear to her that i expect an apology from her for making such a false and outrageous claim .

clegg says he has set this out in a letter to say about another politician , particularly someone you are governing with , that you are putting children at risk , when it 's not true , is a level of outrageous misinformation that i have not witnessed in the four and a half years i 've been in this government .
q : what do you think about tax discs being taken away ?
what will traffic wardens do now ?
clegg says they will still be able to check if a car is taxed .
he 's not sure if that will make life harder for traffic wardens .

documents.title: nick clegg 's lbc phone-in
text: nick clegg is hosting his phone-in .
q : i 'm a gp .
i have a problem with what the political parties are saying about gp funding .
where are we going to get gps if newly-qualified doctors refuse to go into general practice ?
clegg says he knows gps are feeling under considerable pressure .
they do n't want to hear politicians make pledges they do n't think are deliverable .
but there are 1,000 more gps now than when the coalition started , and another 1,000 in the pipeline , he says .
he says his grandfather was a gp .
he knows it 's a vocation .
but he says the coalition 's changes have given gps and others much more say about how money is spent in the nhs .
q : why do n't politicians listen to what gps are saying ?
clegg says politicians are entitled to ask how services could be approved .
current health services were designed for a different era , without today 's ageing population .
if you 're not a fan of david cameron , it is probably best to avoid the papers today .
they 've all covered his party conference speech and , especially in the conservative papers ( some of which have n't always been very keen on the prime minister ) , the reviews are adulatory .
the headlines could not have been better if craig oliver had written them himself .
my colleague roy greenslade has produced a full round-up of the coverage .
here 's how it starts .
the tory conference may have started with negative headlines for david cameron but he will surely be enjoying today 's press coverage .
praise was lavished on his speech .
it was variously scintillating '' ( daily express ) , rousing '' ( the sun ) and electrifying '' ( daily mail and daily telegraph ) .
so moved was the mail that its front page proclaimed : at last , a real tory premier . ''
the telegraph shouted ( well , it was a large headline ) : cameron gives 30m a tax cut '' .
the daily express was delighted to report tax cuts boost for 30 million '' while the times told its readers of cameron 's £ 7bn tax giveaway to middle class '' .
metro sat it the other way round , cameron : we 'll cut tax for poor . ''

the sun , which loves to place itself in the centre of the political stage ( any stage , in fact ) , laid claim to the prime minister having adopted our manifesto '' with a ty punning headline , here cams the sun '' .
and we 'll soon find out what nick clegg has to say .
he 's got his lbc phone-in this morning .
generally , though , it looks quiet today .
here 's the agenda .
9am : nick clegg hosts his lbc phone-in .
11am : nigel farage , the ukip leader , campaigns in heywood and middleton ahead of next week 's byelection .
1.45pm : ed miliband campaigns in heywood ahead of the byelection .
if you want to follow me on twitter , i 'm on @ twitterid .

key_events.text:
9.18am BST
09:18
Clegg demanding apology from May for 'false and outrageous claim' about Lib Dems

bulletin.text: Rolling coverage of all the day's political developments as they happen, including Nick Clegg's LBC phone-in.
